item.title: $|A|$: Determinant of a Matrix
item.description: Breakdown \(2 \times 2\) Matrix \(3 \times 3\) Matrix \(4 \times 4\) Matrix (and Beyond) R Custom Base R Python NumPy Rcpp RcppArmadillo Environment This post was last updated on 2018-12-11. Breakdown \(2 \times 2\) Matrix \[ A = \begin{bmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{bmatrix} \] \[ \left| \begin{matrix} \color{red}a & & & & \color{blue}b \\ & \color{red}\nwarrow & & \color{blue}\nearrow \\ & & \large\times & & \\ & \color{blue}\swarrow & & \color{red}\searrow \\ \color{blue}c & & & & \color{red}d \\ \end{matrix} \right| \]

item.title: Linear Algebra
item.description: Setup R Python Scalar Multiplication Example R Rcpp Python Matrix-Vector Multiplication Breakdown Example R Rcpp Python Vector-Matrix Multiplication Breakdown Example R Rcpp Python Matrix-Matrix Multiplication Breakdown Example R Rcpp Python Transpose Breakdown R Rcpp Python Environment This post was last updated on 2018-12-11. Setup library(reticulate) R Base R r_mat <- matrix(c(1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9), nrow = 3, ncol = 3) r_mat #> [,1] [,2] [,3] #> [1,] 1 4 7 #> [2,] 2 5 8 #> [3,] 3 6 9 Python NumPy import numpy as np np_mat = np.

item.title: Mean
item.description: R Base R Rcpp Sugar Custom Blueprint Templated RcppParallel Python Pure Python NumPy Numba Parallel CuPy Shootout Environment R Base R r_vector <- c(126, 793, 999, 525, 851, 798, 120, 714, 852, 151, 190, 41, 612, 826, 507, 105, 14, 237, 669, 7) mean(r_vector) #> [1] 456.85 Rcpp Sugar #include <Rcpp.h> // [[Rcpp::export]] double rcpp_sugar_mean(Rcpp::NumericVector x) { return Rcpp::mean(x); } r_vector <- c(126, 793, 999, 525, 851, 798, 120, 714, 852, 151, 190, 41, 612, 826, 507, 105, 14, 237, 669, 7) rcpp_sugar_mean(r_vector) #> [1] 456.

item.title: Median
item.description: What is it? R Base R Custom Base R Rcpp Sugar Custom Blueprint Templated Python Pure Python NumPy Numba Parallel CuPy Shootout Environment What is it? Given a sequence, which is the middle-most value. Put another way, what value is equally likely to be greater than the first half of a sorted sequence and lesser than the second half of a sorted sequence.
